document_notes.text:
This update for yaml-cpp fixes the following issues:

- CVE-2018-20573: Fixed remote DOS via a crafted YAML file in function Scanner:EnsureTokensInQueue (bsc#1121227).
- CVE-2018-20574: Fixed remote DOS via a crafted YAML file in function SingleDocParser:HandleFlowMap (bsc#1121230).
- CVE-2019-6285: Fixed remote DOS via a crafted YAML file in function SingleDocParser::HandleFlowSequence (bsc#1122004).
- CVE-2019-6292: Fixed DOS by stack consumption in singledocparser.cpp (bsc#1122021).
document_notes.title: Details

notes.text: An issue was discovered in singledocparser.cpp in yaml-cpp (aka LibYaml-C++) 0.6.2. Stack Exhaustion occurs in YAML::SingleDocParser, and there is a stack consumption problem caused by recursive stack frames: HandleCompactMap, HandleMap, HandleFlowSequence, HandleSequence, HandleNode. Remote attackers could leverage this vulnerability to cause a denial-of-service via a cpp file.
notes.title: Vulnerability Description
